users.title: Users
users.subtitle: Create, read, update and delete users

createUser.title: Create User
createUser.subtitle: Create a new user
createUser.notification: An external user management system is activated. Users created here will not be transferred to the external user management.

external.label: External
external.helpText: This user is managed by an external system.

error.validate: Password has to be between 6 and 1024 characters

confirmAlert.title: Delete User
confirmAlert.message: Do you really want to delete the user?

userForm.subtitle: Edit User
userForm.userIsInternal: This user is managed internally by SCM-Manager
userForm.userIsExternal: This user is managed by an external system

modal.passwordRequired: Set New Password for Internal User

publicKey.subtitle: Public Keys
publicKey.description: To check signatures (for example for commits), gpg public keys can be stored here. Additionally the keys created by SCM-Manager can be accessed here, too.

deleteConfirmAlert.title: Public Key
deleteConfirmAlert.message: Do you really want to delete this public key?

apiKey.subtitle: API Keys
apiKey.text1: Create and manage personal access tokens to access the REST API or use as a password for SCM clients. The privileges of these tokens are limited to repositories and the selected role.
apiKey.manageRoles: You may view and create roles in the administration view “Permission Roles”.
apiKey.text2: To use the token in a REST request, pass it as a cookie named “X-Bearer-Token”. You may use the token as your password for SCM clients, too.

permissionRole.label: Permitted Role
permissionRole.help: The api key will be restricted to permissions of this role

modal.title: Key Created
modal.text1: Your new API key is ready. You can use it as a bearer token for REST calls or as a password for SCM clients.
modal.text2: Store your API key in a safe place now! It is only displayed now and cannot be recovered later.

deleteConfirmAlert.title: API Key
deleteConfirmAlert.message: Do you really want to delete this API key?

permissionOverview.title: Permission Overview
permissionOverview.help: If the user has logged in at leas once, this overview is based on the groups assigned to the user at the last login. Therefor this also includes groups, that have not been set up in SCM-Manager but were provided by external systems (such as LDAP). Because this view is based on the last login of the user, this might not reflect the current state of the external groups if the user would log in now. If the user has never logged in before, only the internal groups for this user will be listed.

groups.showGroupsWithoutPermission: Show external groups not yet created in SCM-Manager
groups.showGroupsWithoutPermissionHelp: This option shows foreign groups. These are groups, that have come from external systems and are unknown to SCM-Manager. The assign permissions for these groups, they have to be created in SCM-Manager first (as external groups).
